![Chuncheon Myeongdong Street (Ï∂òÏ≤ú Î™ÖÎèôÍ±∞Î¶¨)](/2022-07-25-1658757394112/2030528_image2_1.webp) ## Overview > The street was named after Seoul‚Äôs Myeong-dong street as it became the main street of Chuncheon. Government offices, such as Gangwon-do Provincial Office and Chuncheon City Hall, and major banks are located nearby the street, and various shops specialized in clothes, cosmetics, and shoes, as well as cafes and restaurants are located in the street. The sculpture built to remember the street as the filming location for the Korean TV drama Winter Sonata is located in the middle of Myeongdong Street. In addition, the street has large shopping malls, such as M Department Store and Brown 5th Avenue, cinema, and other attractions. The large-scale underground shopping center established based on the Jungang Rotary, houses some 350 stores where customers can enjoy shopping and relaxation in any weather. The Myeongdong Street connects to other Chuncheon‚Äôs tourist destinations, including Myeongdong Dakgalbi Alley of Chuncheon, Yungnim Pass, and Chuncheon Jungang Market. ## Intro | | | | - | - | |infocenter:|‚Ä¢ 1330 Travel Hotline: +82-2-1330
(English, Korean, Japanese, Chinese)
‚Ä¢ For more info: +82-33-250-3089| ## Detail Image ![/2022-07-25-1658757394112/2030526_image2_1.webp](/2022-07-25-1658757394112/2030526_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-07-25-1658757394112/2030527_image2_1.webp](/2022-07-25-1658757394112/2030527_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-07-25-1658757394112/2030529_image2_1.webp](/2022-07-25-1658757394112/2030529_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-07-25-1658757394112/2030530_image2_1.webp](/2022-07-25-1658757394112/2030530_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-07-25-1658757394112/2030532_image2_1.webp](/2022-07-25-1658757394112/2030532_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-07-25-1658757394112/2030533_image2_1.webp](/2022-07-25-1658757394112/2030533_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-07-25-1658757394112/2495147_image2_1.webp](/2022-07-25-1658757394112/2495147_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-07-25-1658757394112/2495151_image2_1.webp](/2022-07-25-1658757394112/2495151_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-07-25-1658757394112/619243_image2_1.webp](/2022-07-25-1658757394112/619243_image2_1.webp) ## Contact - [‚òéÔ∏è+82-33-250-3089](tel:+82332503089) - [üè†tour.chuncheon.go.kr](http://tour.chuncheon.go.kr/) ```googleMap latitude: 37.8800481627 longitude: 127.7275492614 title: 55, Jungang-ro, Chuncheon-si, Gangwon-do ``` ## Directions [Bus]
Take bus 7, 9, 64, or 64-2 across from Chuncheon Intercity Bus Terminal.
Get off at Myeong-dong Bus Stop. (10 min ride)

[Subway]
Chuncheon Station (Gyeongchun Line)
Take bus 63 and get off at Myeong-dong Bus Stop. (10 min ride)

data.title: Chuncheon Myeongdong Street (Ï∂òÏ≤ú Î™ÖÎèôÍ±∞Î¶¨)
data.description: The street was named after Seoul‚Äôs Myeong-dong street as it became the main street of Chuncheon. Government offices, such as Gangwon-do Provincial Office and Chuncheon City Hall, and major banks are located nearby the street, and various shops specialized in clothes, cosmetics, and shoes, as well as cafes and restaurants are located in the street. The sculpture built to remember the street as the filming location for the Korean TV drama Winter Sonata is located in the middle of Myeongdong Street. In addition, the street has large shopping malls, such as M Department Store and Brown 5th Avenue, cinema, and other attractions. The large-scale underground shopping center established based on the Jungang Rotary, houses some 350 stores where customers can enjoy shopping and relaxation in any weather. The Myeongdong Street connects to other Chuncheon‚Äôs tourist destinations, including Myeongdong Dakgalbi Alley of Chuncheon, Yungnim Pass, and Chuncheon Jungang Market.
data.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Taebaek Sangjang-dong Mural Village (ÌÉúÎ∞± ÏÉÅÏû•Îèô Î≤ΩÌôîÎßàÏùÑ)
dataList.description: Taebaek Sangjang-dong Mural Village, also called ‚ÄúNambu Village‚Äù, is located in Sangjang-dong, Taebaek-si as the name refers. The village has been improved upon by residents who volunteered and shared their artistic talents to participate in Taebaek-si‚Äôs new village movement in 2011. Each alley throughout the village gives a unique and refreshing ambience that created a turning point in the village. Also, valuable events such as ‚ÄòYeontan (briquette) painting contest‚Äô are held for students and families to participate in and share their warm hearts. The Central Inland Region Train (O-Train), which began operating as of April 12, 2013 by Korail, stops in Taebaek-si, so tourists can easily reach the mural village via train.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Taebaek Guwau Village (Alpine Botanical Garden) (ÌÉúÎ∞± Íµ¨ÏôÄÏö∞ÎßàÏùÑ(Í≥†ÏõêÏûêÏÉùÏãùÎ¨ºÏõê))
dataList.description:
Guwau Village is located below Pijae Hill (also called Samsuryeong) at the entrance to Maebongsan Mountain. The village got its name because its topography resembles the scenery of nine cows peacefully lying around. The Alpine Botanical Garden is located 800-900 meters above sea level and protects the endangered alpine plant species from disappearing.

The botanical garden also offers visitors an opportunity to conveniently observe some rare flowers and plants. In August, when the sunflowers are in full bloom, the Taebaek Sunflower Festival is held at Guwau Village. In addition to celebrating the area‚Äôs wide array of colorful flowers, the festival also has a variety of attractions such as a drawing exhibition, a photo exhibition, and an environmental sculpture exhibition using repurposed materials.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Taebaek Coal Museum (ÌÉúÎ∞±ÏÑùÌÉÑÎ∞ïÎ¨ºÍ¥Ä)
dataList.description: Taebaek Coal Museum is located where coal was first discovered within Korea. While coal has declined in use, the resource served an important role in the modernization of the nation. The museum is a place where you can learn about the history of Korea‚Äôs coal industry through well-organized exhibitions.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Sutasa Temple (ÏàòÌÉÄÏÇ¨)
dataList.description:
Gongjaksan Mountain (887 m), home to Sutasa Temple and named for its resemblance to a peacock proudly displaying its tail feathers, gives visitors a bird‚Äôs-eye-view of Hongcheon. From the bottom, Gongjaksan Mountain looks like a giant laying on his back, looking up to the sky. The mountain offers elegant azaleas in spring, beautiful fall foliage, majestic cliffs with unusual rocks, colonies of pine trees, and a serene snowscape in winter.

Sutasa Valley, stretching over 12 kilometers between Sutasa Temple and Nocheon-ri, is full of large ponds and broad bedrocks and is flanked by rocky cliffs and pine groves.

Located among the foothills, Sutasa Temple is an ancient temple built by Monk Wonhyo in AD 708. The temple boasts numerous cultural properties including the gabled roof of Daejeokgwangjeon, a bronze bell, a three-tiered pagoda, and Wolinseokbo, a biography of Buddha that has been designated as a National Treasure.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Sundamgyegok Valley (ÏàúÎã¥Í≥ÑÍ≥°)
dataList.description: Located 5 kilometers northwest of Cheorwon-gun Office, Sundamgyegok Valley is one of the most beautiful valleys among the branches of the Hantangang River. It offers fantastic scenery of fascinating rock formations, steep cliffs, and ponds. The valley is filled with abundant water, trimmed by rare naturally white sand. Also, the stream behind the valley attracts many rafters each year.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Sun Cruise Theme Park (Ïç¨ÌÅ¨Î£®Ï¶à ÌÖåÎßàÍ≥µÏõê)
dataList.description: Sun Cruise Resort is a cruise-shaped resort located on a cliff 60 meters above sea level. Surrounding the resort is an extensive park, with themed gardens and sculptures. The park offers an exquisite landscape with its large man-made lake and coconut trees. The resort also has a sculpture park that displays 30 sculptures and a jangseung (traditional Korean totem pole) park with 250 jangseung totems from Andong. Visitors can also stop for a cup of coffee at a train-themed cafe or a sailboat-themed cafe.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Statue of Soyanggang Maid (ÏÜåÏñëÍ∞ïÏ≤òÎÖÄÏÉÅ)
dataList.description: This Soyanggang Maiden Statue stands high between Soyanggang Skywalk and Soyang i(2)gyo Bridge. This statue, representing Korea‚Äôs popular song Soyanggang Cheonyeo (maiden), is 12 m high in total, combining 5 m-high base stone and 7 m-high body. If you see it close to, the statue looks very big. The statue depicts a maiden who holds her skirt hem with one hand and reed with the other, and her breast-knot flapping in the wind. The base stone has the inscription of lyrics. The lyrics belong to the song Soyanggang Cheonyeo composed by Ban Ya-wol, who left hit songs, such as Crossing the Teary Pass of Bakdaljae, and Brokenhearted Miari Ridge.
dataList.author: korea-tour
